title.narrative: Promoting the Sexual and Reproductive Rights of Girls and Young Women, Year 3

description.narrative:
To improve the health and livelihood options of girls and young women in Gulu through the provision of SRHR education, dialogue sessions with parents, and public education. Towards this aim, GECDSO will work in nine schools to provide quarterly SRHR sessions for students and dialogue sessions on gender norms and how to support girls' education, targeting 400 parents. It will also provide SRHR education for 40 out of school girls, along with referrals to friendly service providers, vocational training and seed grants. GECDSO will expand its advocacy efforts through consultations with local community leaders, leaders of bodaboda (motorcycle taxi) groups, and senior teachers, with the aim of identifying allies for community mobilization on girls' rights.
AJWS support to GECDSO contributes to the Uganda SHR strategy outcomes on: 1) increasing access to SRHR services and information, and; 2) strengthening community support for the rights of girls and young women. Since 2014, AJWS has awarded 4 grants to GECDSO totaling $23,697.

participating-org.narrative: Gulu Early Childhood Development support Organization

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
